title.rendered: Contemporary art |  What is it, characteristics, history, painting, sculpture

content.rendered:
Art

The contemporary art It is an important type of art that includes more than fifty types of expressions which have emerged since the end of the Second World War. Gaining an understanding of contemporary art requires the study of many theories that have been put forth over roughly six decades of art. The common denominator is that the talent artistic must be formally recognized by the art world. Some contemporary artists reflect the influence of Modernismincluding the Impressionismthe Surrealism and the Cubismand others separate from Postmodernismeven eliminating all kinds of connection with the artistic movements that occurred in the past.

what is the contemporary art?

It is a concept that names the general form of artistic expressions that originated in the twentieth century or time current from the different hatchings of Vanguard that occurred at the beginning of the present century.

Characteristics of contemporary art

The main characteristics of contemporary art are the following:

  • It is based on the abstract expressionism.
  • has a legacy of vanguards artistic and look for different forms of expression.
  • It has foundations from abstract art.
  • His works are originalsartistic and leave the imprint of the author who makes them.
  • media or instruments to make the works of contemporary art are changing and new technologies are used every day.
  • It is influenced by fauvism, neoplasticism and in the cubism.
  • Give emphasis to the expressions of the I and at emotions.
  • The colors that are used are strong and the content is symbolic.
  • seek to manifest the movement and the repetition of objects on the canvases.
  • art is kind avant-garde Y surreal.

History

Contemporary art originated at the end of the XIX century. It was formed as a result of the dragging of techniques that came from that century, and it is considered that the impressionism and the postimpressionism were the concepts that drove its creation. It was based from its beginnings on different avant-garde movements such as the cubism, expressionism, surrealism, futurism Y Dadaism. These currents had as a common aspect the innovation and giving art a different space than it had in ancient times. Already in the 20th century, contemporary art breaks traditional patterns and imposes new characteristics on the way of making art.

Importance of contemporary art

Contemporary art is important because it gives us the idea that art is not separate from life or the world we live in. The practice of contemporary art has become an exchange between artist and the viewer more than an image or object that we hope to admire. Contemporary art has come to become an extension of life that seeks questions, order Y coherence. Promotes questions about our life And it also brings fun.

Types

The types of art that are included in contemporary art are the following:

  • Fauvism: emerged as a reaction to the impressionism. The main aspect of him was the colorthe stains flat and wide.
  • Cubism: Its creators were Picasso and Braques. used neutral tones to create a fourth dimension. It had greater exaltation of the plane and they used transparencies.
  • Expressionism: It emerged in Germany and was a means to express the heartaches suffered by the individual through paintings full of dramaticsexpressive and through the caricature of the figures.
  • Dadaism: It emerged as a protest before the first World War. It was a kind of mockery before the technology and the progress. His main objective was to scandalize the bourgeoisie of the time.
  • Surrealism: The painters used resources such as animation of the inanimate world, the isolation of anatomy, fantastic machines evoking chaos.
  • Abstract art: Known as art kinetic either pop art, I was looking for a style that would give movement to the works. The base of it said that any kind of shape geometric that was drawn could lose the stability on the retina of the person who was observing it by means of optical illusion.

Architecture

It is mainly the modern architecture of our times that begins to be created in the century XX. The main idea of ​​this type of architecture is to reject the historical styles that were used in ancient times. It arises from the change that the Revolution brings Industrial and the revolution French because with them new materials of construction and costs of the products were reduced. The most important buildings were columns, temples, triumphal arches and the propylaea. Iron, zinc and glass began to be used. The engineering began to have more importance in architecture.

Sculpture

It is considered one of the most modern in art and was influenced by different artistic movements. The change is its main characteristic and the functions traditions that it had were lost over time. The sculptures include New Materials and new ones were used functions Y symbologies. Its tendencies are constantly evolution and the human figure with contemporary art lost importance.

Paint

It arises as a consequence of modern Art and its bases were a set of signs Y symbols started by modern painters. His main moves were impressionism, expressionism Y neo-impressionism. The first modern painter of whom we have reference was Francisco de Goya and the best modern painter was Vincent Van Gogh whose paintings gave rise to abstract painting and Fauvism.

Representatives of contemporary art

Some of the most outstanding representatives of contemporary art are:

  • ai weiwei
  • Jeff Koons
  • yayoi kusama
  • Damian Hirst
  • Yoko Ono
  • Theaster Gates
  • And famous classical artists like Dali, Picasso, Van Gogh.

Examples of notable works

  • gold marilyn monroe by Andy Warhol
  • Blue Poles by Jackson Pollock
  • The Persistence of Memory by Salvador Dali
  • the son of man by Rene Magritte
  • The fountain by Marcel Duchamp
  • The Avignon ladies by Pablo Picasso
  • The kiss by Gustav Klint
